sen.j: 比売神社（ひめがみしゃ）とは、奈良県奈良市にある神社である。
sen.e: Hime-gamisha Shrine is a shrine in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Hime-gamisha Shrine is a Shinto shrine in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Hime-gamisha Shrine is a Shinto shrine in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 比売塚と呼ばれる小さな古墳の上に建てられている。
sen.e: It is built on top of a small burial mound called Hime-zuka.
It is built on top of a small burial mound called Hime-zuka.
It is built on top of a small burial mound called Hime-zuka.

sen.j: 南都鏡神社の摂社である。
sen.e: It is a sessha (auxiliary shrine dedicated to a deity closely related to that of a main shrine) of Nantokagami-jinja Shrine.
It is a sessha (auxiliary shrine dedicated to a deity closely related to that of a main shrine) of Nantokagami-jinja Shrine.
It is a sessha (auxiliary shrine dedicated to a deity closely related to that of a main shrine) of Nantokagami-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 祭神
sen.e: Enshrined Deities
Enshrined Deities
Enshrined Deities

sen.j: 十市皇女を祭神とし、市寸嶋比売（いちきしまひめ）を脇座とする。
sen.e: The enshrined deity is Tochi no Himemiko (Emperor Tenmu's daughter), and Ichikishima Hime (goddess of water) is the auxiliary deity.
The enshrined deity is Tochi no Himemiko (Emperor Tenmu's daughter), and Ichikishima Hime (goddess of water) is the auxiliary deity.
The enshrined deity is Tochi no Himemiko (Emperor Tenmu's daughter), and Ichikishima Hime (goddess of water) is the auxiliary deity.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 比売塚は古くから「高貴の姫君の墓」と語り伝えられており、日本書紀の記載にある「天武天皇6年（678年）4月14日に十市皇女を、天武天皇10年（682年）に氷上娘を「赤穂」の地に葬った」とされるこの二人ではないかと考えられている。
sen.e: According to legend Hime-zuka is a 'noble princesses' grave;' in Nihon Shoki (Chronicles of Japan) it is said that 'Emperor Tenmu buried Tochi no Himemiko on April 14, 678 and Hikami no Iratsume (his wife) in 682 in the land of Ako (currently Hyogo Prefecture)', and it is thought that the 'noble princesses' may refer to these two.

According to legend Hime-zuka, is a 'the grave of a noble princesses,' and "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan) states that 'Emperor Tenmu buried Tochi no Himemiko on April 14, 678 and Hikami no Iratsume (his wife) in 682 in the land of Ako (currently Hyogo Prefecture)', and it is thought that the 'noble princesses' may refer to these two individuals..

According to legend Hime-zuka, is a 'the grave of a noble princesses,' and "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan) states that 'Emperor Tenmu buried Tochi no Himemiko on April 14, 678 and Hikami no Iratsume (his wife) in 682 in the land of Ako (currently Hyogo Prefecture)', and it is thought that the 'noble princesses' may refer to these two individuals..

sen.j: この近くには赤穂神社がある。
sen.e: Ako-jinja shrine is located nearby.
Ako-jinja shrine is located nearby.
Ako-jinja shrine is located nearby.

sen.j: 1920年代に比売塚は国有となって奈良財務局の管理下におかれたが、地元の有志の奔走によって奈良財務局から比売塚の払い下げを受けたのを機に、そこに神社を造営することとなった。
sen.e: In 1920 Hime-zuka became national property and put under the Nara Finance Bureau Ministry of Finance's management; when local volunteers were able to successfully inherit Hime-zuka from the ministry, a shrine was built there.

In 1920 Hime-zuka became national property and placed under the management of the Nara Finance Bureau Ministry of Finance's but a shrine was built there when local volunteers were successfully granted Hime-zuka by the ministry.

In 1920 Hime-zuka became national property and placed under the management of the Nara Finance Bureau Ministry of Finance's but a shrine was built there when local volunteers were successfully granted Hime-zuka by the ministry.

sen.j: 比売塚の現形9坪を新薬師寺に寄進し、神殿・祭祀を南都鏡神社の摂社として委任することとした。
sen.e: It was decided that the 29.7-square-meter Hime-zuka would be donated to Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple, and the shinden (main shrine) would be a sessha to Nantokagami-jinja Shrine and perform its religious services.

It was decided that the 29.7-square-meter Hime-zuka would be donated to Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple, and the shinden (main shrine) would be a sessha of Nantokagami-jinja Shrine and perform its religious services.

It was decided that the 29.7-square-meter Hime-zuka would be donated to Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple, and the shinden (main shrine) would be a sessha of Nantokagami-jinja Shrine and perform its religious services.

sen.j: 1980年夏、新薬師寺・鏡神社の協力により地鎮祭が、同年末に上棟祭が行われた。
sen.e: In the summer of 1980 a ground-breaking ceremony was held with the cooperation of Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple and Kagami-jinja Shrine, and at the end of that year the topping out ceremony was held.
In the summer of 1980 a ground-breaking ceremony was held with the cooperation of Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple and Kagami-jinja Shrine, and at the end of that year the topping out ceremony was held.
In the summer of 1980 a ground-breaking ceremony was held with the cooperation of Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple and Kagami-jinja Shrine, and at the end of that year the topping out ceremony was held.

sen.j: 1981年、十市皇女の命日である4月7日を新暦に換算した日である5月10日に鎮座奉祝祭が斎行され、十市皇女を祀る比売神社が誕生した。
sen.e: The enshrinement ceremony was held in1981 on the death anniversary of Tochi no Himemiko, May 10, marking the birth of Hime-gamisha Shrine enshrining Tochi no Himemiko.
The enshrinement ceremony was held in 1981 on the death anniversary of Tochi no Himemiko, May 10, marking the birth of Hime-gamisha Shrine enshrining Tochi no Himemiko.
The enshrinement ceremony was held in 1981 on the death anniversary of Tochi no Himemiko, May 10, marking the birth of Hime-gamisha Shrine enshrining Tochi no Himemiko.

sen.j: 施設
sen.e: Facilities
Facilities
Facilities

sen.j: 社殿 -- 高さ約2.5m、幅約2mほどの社殿が建てられている。
sen.e: Shinden – The shinden is approximately 2.5m in height and 2m in width.
Shinden – The shinden is approximately 2.5m in height and 2m in width.
Shinden – The shinden is approximately 2.5m in height and 2m in width.

sen.j: 社殿の正面1.5mぐらいのところに朱塗りの門があり、その門は閉ざされていてそこから中に入ることはできないようになっている。
sen.e: There is a red gate about 1.5m from the front of the shinden, which remains closed so no one can enter.
There is a red gate about 1.5m from the front of the shinden, which remains closed so no one can enter.
There is a red gate about 1.5m from the front of the shinden, which remains closed so no one can enter.

sen.j: 社殿に付いている鈴と、その門とが紐で結ばれており、参拝者は門前からその紐をゆらして鈴を鳴らすようになっている。
sen.e: A bell attached to the shinden is connected to the gate by rope, and worshippers pull on that rope to ring the bell.
A bell attached to the shinden is connected to the gate by rope, and worshippers pull on that rope to ring the bell.
A bell attached to the shinden is connected to the gate by rope, and worshippers pull on that rope to ring the bell.

sen.j: 神像石 -- 社殿の正面向かって左側に、男女が睦まじく肩を寄せあっている像が彫られた高さ1.5mぐらいの石があり、その左に「神像石（かむかたいし）」という、大友皇子・十市皇女から淡海三船までの4代とそれぞれの妃を祀った石が置かれている。
sen.e: Kamukata-ishi (stone god statue) - To the left facing the shinden, there is a stone approximately 1.5m tall with the engraving of a couple leaning happily close to each other, and the 'Kamukata-ishi' which enshrines four generations of emperors from Emperor Daiyu to Atami Sanzen and their corresponding empresses, beginning with Empress Toichi, is placed to the left of that stone.
sen.cmt: Not apparent whether Kamukataishi is singular or plural – here it has been translated as singular.
sen.e: Kamukata-ishi (stone god statue) - To the left facing the shinden, there is a stone approximately 1.5m tall with the engraving of a couple leaning happily close to each other, and the 'Kamukata-ishi' which enshrines four generations of emperors from Emperor Daiyu to Atami Sanzen and their corresponding empresses, beginning with Empress Toichi, is placed to the left of that stone.

Kamukata-ishi (stone god statue) - To the left facing the shinden, there is a stone approximately 1.5m tall with the engraving of a couple leaning happily close to each other, and the 'Kamukata-ishi' which enshrines four generations of emperors from Prince Otomo to Omi no Mifune and their corresponding empresses, beginning with Princess Tochi, is placed to the left of that stone.
sen.cmt: 大友皇子はPrince Otomo、淡海三船はOmi no Mifune、土市皇女はPrincess Tochiと修正しました。

sen.j: そのほか、社殿の脇に絵馬を掛ける場所があり、良縁を願う人々の絵馬が多数掛かっている。
sen.e: In addition there is a place to hang ema (votive horse tablets), housing numerous ema belonging to people wishing for good matches.
In addition there is a place to hang ema (votive horse tablets), housing numerous ema belonging to people wishing for good matches.
In addition there is a place to hang ema (votive horse tablets), housing numerous ema belonging to people wishing for good matches.

sen.j: その前には小さな石が置かれ、万葉集の「河の上の斎つ岩群に草むさず 常にもがもな常処女にて」という歌が彫られている。
sen.e: There is a small stone placed in front of the area with the inscription of a song from Manyoshu (oldest anthology of Japanese poems): 'Just as there is no grass growing on the holy rocks in the river, wishing you remain unchanged as an eternal virgin.'

There is a small stone placed in front of the area with the inscription of a song from Manyoshu (oldest anthology of Japanese poems): 'Just as there is no grass growing on the holy rocks in the river, wishing you remain unchanged as an eternal virgin.'

There is a small stone placed in front of the area with the inscription of a song from Manyoshu (oldest anthology of Japanese poems): 'Just as there is no grass growing on the holy rocks in the river, wishing you remain unchanged as an eternal virgin.'

sen.j: 交通アクセス
sen.e: Directions
Access
Access

sen.j: 近鉄奈良駅から奈良交通バス「中循環」で「破石町」下車東へ徒歩10分
sen.e: From Kintetsu Nara Station take Nara Kotsu bus 'Naka-Junkan' line to 'Wariishi-cho' and walk east ten minutes.
From Kintetsu Nara Station take Nara Kotsu bus 'Naka-Junkan' line to 'Wariishi-cho' and walk east for ten minutes.
From Kintetsu Nara Station take Nara Kotsu bus 'Naka-Junkan' line to 'Wariishi-cho' and walk east for ten minutes.

sen.j: JR奈良駅から奈良交通バス「市内循環」又は「中循環」で「破石町」下車東へ徒歩10分
sen.e: From JR Nata Station take Nara Kotsu bus 'Shinai Junkan' line or 'Naka-Junkan' line to 'Wariishi-cho' and walk east ten minutes.
From JR Nata Station take Nara Kotsu bus 'Shinai Junkan' line or 'Naka-Junkan' line to 'Wariishi-cho' and walk east for ten minutes.
From JR Nata Station take Nara Kotsu bus 'Shinai Junkan' line or 'Naka-Junkan' line to 'Wariishi-cho' and walk east for ten minutes.
